channel.title: The John Carter Show (mp3) (mp3)
channel.description: John Carter brings you the best unsigned music from all around the world!
channel.itunes:author: DJ Jpeg
channel.itunes:summary: John Carter brings you the best unsigned music from all around the world!

item.title: UFO
item.itunes:author: DJ Jpeg
item.itunes:summary:
Some time ago, me & DJ Don't Panic set up a competition for you, our listeners, to win a copy of "UFOi" by My Lost Remedy and some awesome WTN merchandise.
Thank you all for your entries and making us all giggle! Special thanks to Kayleigh Chambers for your clear evidence that THE TRUTH IS OUT THERE!! xD The CD and your merchandise is on it's way!
In this podcast we read out some of our listeners stories including the winning tale of intrigue! Also news about yellow things and Josh's bike gets stolen.
Music From; Serene Race To Save Vegas Ryker Sear Frantic Alice Fronz Arp & Delta Pavonis
item.description:

item.title: The Meaning Of Life
item.itunes:author: DJ Jpeg
item.itunes:summary:
Some time ago, DJ Don't Panic and I set up a competition for one of our listeners to come and join us on a podcast by answering one simple question;
What do YOU think the meaning of life is?
One answer stood out to us amongst the rest (probably for the wrong reasons), sent in by Betty Knox, director of the MK Roller Derby League.
Her answer was "42".
We met with Betty to discuss life, the universe and indeed everything, but instead, we got this...
Enjoy?
item.description:

item.title: Home Today
item.itunes:author: DJ Jpeg
item.itunes:summary:
Home Today is the all new EP by Shallow Side from Alabama in the USA.
I was lucky enough to catch them in a Burger King in West Virginia with the power of Skype to talk to them briefly about their latest release.
This is that conversation.
Enjoy :)
item.description:

item.title: Dead Cells
item.itunes:author: DJ Jpeg
item.itunes:summary:
Since starting Wake the Nation, Dead Cells have always been one of my favourite bands. They have an exceptional presence both live and in the studio. They're great passion for their art shines through and is evident in the sheer volume of gigs, press coverage and general attention these guys are getting right now.
Recently i was lucky enough to book them for one of WTN's live showcases but even more lucky to have the chance to meet them, sit down and have a chat.
This is that discussion.
Unfortunately toward the end of the interview the studio was raided by the police on a completely unrelated and unconnected matter (it really did have nothing to do us!), bringing the whole interview to a nice comfortable, if a bit unexpected, stop.
As always, enjoy :)
http://www.tinyurl.com/wtnradio

item.title: Vanity (Frantic Alice)
item.itunes:author: DJ Jpeg
item.itunes:summary:
Me and Jack Spence first met at the birthday party of our mutual friend and ex Frantic Alice guitarist Jim Terrill. To cut a long story short; I drank half a large bottle of Jack Daniels and proceeded to drunkenly play fight with the then Frantic Alice Drummer Jack Allonby. Jack Spence then proceeded to punch me in the face which in my present state sent me hurtling toward the ground and open to being dragged around by my leg (thanks Jack).
The moral of the story is don't fuck with Jacks...chances are it'll come back to punch you in the face one day!
Me and Jack Spence (or Jakk Vanity as he is now known) have come a long way since that night. Just last week he drove me to the hospital after an incident involving cheap vodka, Swedish cider, glass and gravity.
This is a conversation between myself and the most Vain man in the entire world of music.
Enjoy!

item.title: The Rules
item.itunes:author: DJ Jpeg
item.itunes:summary:
These are the WTN Rules;
1. No diving in the shallow end. 2. Exact change only. 3. Lights out at 8. 4. No shoes. 5. ID badges must be worn at all times. 6. Keep arms and legs inside the cart at all times. 7. No parking - Loading only. 8. No Steve's anymore.
Music from; Black JuJu Organic Cure the Common Lunar Dusk Fronz Arp
http://www.tinyurl.com/wtnradio

item.title: Soggy Biscuits
item.itunes:author: DJ Jpeg
item.itunes:summary:
More music and madness from the mind of the reclusive and slightly feral John Carter.
Songs by the beautiful people who are;
Moonshine Avenue Red Sun Rising Manhattan Shallow Side Bury The Ladybird
FOR YOUR CHANCE TO COME INTO THE STUDIO AND BE ON A SHOW WITH THE DJS TELL US WHAT YOU THINK THE MEANING OF LIFE IS! Send your emails to wtnradio@hotmail.co.uk or go to tinyurl.com/wtnradio and click on "contact us".
See you next time you wonderfully smashing people!
